SEARCH
Package me.yleoft.zAPI.utility

Class ExternalDependencyManager

java.lang.Object
me.yleoft.zAPI.utility.ExternalDependencyManager
public final class ExternalDependencyManager extends Object
External dependency manager for Java 17: - Register JAR dependencies by direct URL - Download into a user-provided static directory - Load into isolated classloaders to avoid version conflicts This intentionally does NOT relocate/shade packages. Isolation avoids conflicts without bytecode rewriting.

      public Path download(String id) throws IOException, InterruptedException
      Download a dependency into: STATIC_DIRECTORY/downloads/-.jar Simple caching: if file exists and is non-empty, it is reused.

      IOException

    • loadIsolated

      public URLClassLoader loadIsolated(String id, ClassLoader parent) throws IOException, InterruptedException
      Loads ONE dependency into its own isolated classloader. This is the strongest way to avoid version conflicts between external dependencies. Note: types loaded in this classloader should not “leak” across boundaries. Communicate via your own API interfaces loaded by the parent.
      Throws:
      IOException
      InterruptedException

    • loadAllIntoOneIsolatedLoader

      public URLClassLoader loadAllIntoOneIsolatedLoader(ClassLoader parent) throws IOException, InterruptedException
      Loads ALL dependencies into ONE isolated classloader (still isolated from the app). Use this when the external jars need to see each other.
      Throws:
      IOException
      InterruptedException

    • loadEachIsolated

      public Map<String,URLClassLoader> loadEachIsolated(ClassLoader parent) throws IOException, InterruptedException
      Convenience: load all dependencies as separate isolated classloaders.
      Throws:
      IOException
